intro: Lobelia usafuensis, commonly known as the Usafuensis Lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of eastern Africa. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
